sect1.title: Using the vocoders
sect1.para: Note that most vocoders use short inputs instead of floats. This means you must convert audio signals from float to short by using a type conversion and a scaling factor. See the examples.

The format of the encoded audio is different for every encoder. See the individual block's documentation for the data format. Encoded data is usually a vector of fixed length, and can either be packed or unpacked.
